tit.e: Imperial Prince Shogoinnomiya Yoshikoto (Shogoinnomiya Yoshikoto Shinno)
Imperial Prince Shogoinnomiya Yoshikoto (Shogoinnomiya Yoshikoto Shinno)
Imperial Prince Shogoinnomiya Yoshikoto (Shogoinnomiya Yoshikoto Shinno)

sen.j: 聖護院宮嘉言親王（しょうごいんのみや よしことしんのう）、文政4年1月26日 (旧暦)（1821年2月28日） - 慶応4年8月11日 (旧暦)（1868年9月26日））は、江戸時代末期、明治時代の日本の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Shogoinnomiya Yoshikoto (February 28, 1821 - September 26, 1828) is one of the Imperial family members between the end of Edo period and the Meiji period.
The Imperial Prince Shogoinnomiya Yoshikoto (February 28, 1821 - September 26, 1868) was one of the Imperial Family members between the end of Edo period and the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。is→was,1828→1868,Imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。
sen.e: The Imperial Prince Shogoinnomiya Yoshikoto (February 28, 1821 - September 26, 1868) was one of the Imperial Family members between the end of Edo period and the Meiji period.

sen.j: 伏見宮邦家親王の第2王子。
sen.e: He is the second son of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie.
He was the second prince of the Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie.
sen.cmt: is→was,son→prince と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: He was the second prince of the Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie.

sen.j: 母は上野寿野、幼称は多嘉宮 （たよしのみや）。
sen.e: His mother is Hisano UENO, and he was called Tayoshinomiya when he was a child.
His mother was Hisano UENO, and he was called Tayoshinomiya when he was a child.
sen.cmt: is→was と修正しました。「上野寿野」の読みは確認できておりません。
sen.e: His mother was Hisano UENO, and he was called Tayoshinomiya when he was a child.

sen.j: 天保2年（1831年）に出家し、雄仁入道親王と称した。
sen.e: In 1831, he became a priest, and he called himself Priestly Imperial Prince Yunin.
In 1831, he entered priesthood, and he called himself the priestly Imperial Prince Yunin.
sen.cmt: became a priest→entered priesthood,Priestly→priestly と修正しました。 the を補いました。
sen.e: In 1831, he entered priesthood, and he called himself the priestly Imperial Prince Yunin.

sen.j: 同年、光格天皇の猶子となり、天保3年（1832年）に親王宣下を受け、嘉言（よしこと）と命名される。
sen.e: The same year, he was adopted by Emperor Kokaku and given the title of Imperial Prince and the name Yoshikoto.
The same year, he was adopted to the Emperor Kokaku and given the title of imperial prince and the name Yoshikoto.
sen.cmt: by→to,Imperial Prince→imperial prince と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: The same year, he was adopted to the Emperor Kokaku and given the title of imperial prince and the name Yoshikoto.

sen.j: 同年、京都山科の門跡寺院曼殊院に入室した。
sen.e: The same year, he went to Manshuin, a monzeki temple (a temple where some Imperial family members lived and practiced Buddhism) in Yamashina, Kyoto Prefecture, to study Buddhism.
The same year, he entered Manshuin, a monzeki temple (a temple where some Imperial Family members lived and practiced Buddhism) in Yamashina, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「門跡寺院」は用語集にて確認しました。went to→entered,Imperial family→Imperial Family と修正しました。to study Buddhism を削除しました。
sen.e: The same year, he entered Manshuin, a monzeki temple (a temple where some Imperial Family members lived and practiced Buddhism) in Yamashina, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 慶応4年（1868年）明治維新に際し、聖護院宮（しょうごいんのみや）を称し、還俗し、再び嘉言親王を称する。
sen.e: In 1868, when Meiji Restoration took place, he called himself Shogoinnomiya, and then he returned to secular life and called himself Imperial Prince Yoshikoto again.
sen.cmt: 原文「しょうこういんのみや」を「しょうごいんのみや」に訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1868, when the Meiji Restoration took place, he called himself Shogoinnomiya, and then he returned to secular life and called himself the Imperial Prince Yoshikoto again.
In 1868, when the Meiji Restoration took place, he called himself Shogoinnomiya, and then he returned to secular life and called himself the Imperial Prince Yoshikoto again.

sen.j: その後聖護院宮を譲る。
sen.e: After that, he handed over the name Shogoinnomiya.
After that, he handed over the name Shogoinnomiya.
After that, he handed over the name Shogoinnomiya.

sen.j: 一品に昇叙され、内国事務科内国事務総督となるが、同年のうちに死去。
sen.e: He was promoted to Ippon, which is the first rank of the Imperial Princes' ranks, and he became the governor of Domestic Affairs Office, but he died that year.
sen.cmt: 「内国事務科内国事務総督」の定訳不明
sen.e: He was promoted to Ippon, which is the first rank of the imperial princes' ranks, and he became the governor of Domestic Affairs Office, but he died that year.
sen.cmt: Imperial Princes'→imperial princes と修正しました。「内国事務科内国事務総督」の定訳は確認できておりません。
sen.e: He was promoted to Ippon, which is the first rank of the imperial princes' ranks, and he became the governor of Domestic Affairs Office, but he died that year.
He was 47 when he died.
He was 47 years old when he died.
sen.cmt: years old を補いました。
sen.e: He was 47 years old when he died.

sen.j: 北白川宮智成親王が聖護院宮を相続した。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Kitashirakawanomiya Satonari inherited Shogoinnimiya.
The Imperial Prince Kitashirakawanomiya Satonari inherited Shogoinnimiya.
The Imperial Prince Kitashirakawanomiya Satonari inherited Shogoinnimiya.

sen.j: 父母：伏見宮邦家親王 - 妃鷹司景子 - （実母）女房藤木寿子
sen.e: His father is Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie, his foster mother is Princess Hiroko TAKATSUKASA, and his birth mother is Hisako FUJIKI, court lady.
sen.cmt: 「母は上野寿野」と前述されていましたが、ここでは「藤木寿子」となっています。どちらが正しいか、完全に調べがつかなかったので、訳は原文に従いました。
sen.e: His father was the Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie, his foster mother was the Princess Hiroko TAKATSUKASA, and his birth mother was Hisako FUJIKI, a court lady.
sen.cmt: is→was と修正しました。the, a を補いました。
sen.e: His father was the Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie, his foster mother was the Princess Hiroko TAKATSUKASA, and his birth mother was Hisako FUJIKI, a court lady.

sen.j: 兄弟：山階宮晃親王 - 聖護院宮嘉言親王 - 曼殊院宮譲仁入道親王 - 久邇宮朝彦親王 - 男子 - 伏見宮貞教親王 - 男子 - 小松宮彰仁親王 - 北白川宮能久親王 - 男子 - 男子 - 華頂宮博経親王 - 北白川宮智成親王 - 伏見宮貞愛親王 - 清棲家教 - 閑院宮載仁親王 - 東伏見宮依仁親王（女子省略）
sen.e: His brothers are as follows: Imperial Prince Yamashinanomiya Akira; Imperial Prince Shogoinnomiya Yoshikoto; Priestly Imperial Prince Manshuinnomiya Jonin; Imperial Prince Kuninomiya Asahiko; a son; Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori; a son; Imperial Prince Komatsunomiya Akihito; Imperial Prince Kitashirakawanomiya Yoshihisa; a son; a son; Imperial Prince Kachonomiya Hirotsune; Imperial Prince Kitashirakawanomiya Satonari; Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanaru; Ienori KIYOSU; Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Kotohito; and Imperial Prince Higashifushiminomiya Yorihito. The list of sisters is omitted.
